poem:
### Democracy's Dance  

In the morning's gray light,  
the paper crackles,  
its ink whispering tales  
of a democracy on stage,  
fingers pointing, voices raised.  
Amidst the clamor,  
I sip my coffee, watch sparrows  
debate the merits of crumbs,  
each one a tiny polemicist,  
the world spinning softly  
on its tilted axis,  
enduring another day.
